Title: Security Site Supervisor - Call Center
Description: * *  Allied Universal®, North America’s leading security and facility services company, provides rewarding careers that give you a sense of purpose. While working in a dynamic, diverse and inclusive workplace, you will be part of a team that fuels a culture that will reflect in our communities and customers we serve. We offer medical, dental and vision coverage, life insurance, 401K, employee assistance programs, company discounts, perks and more for all full-time positions!* * *   Wages - Paid Weekly - *  $19.00 per hr - and paid training at Minumum Wage* * *   Full Benefits- Uniforms Provided- Training Provided* *  * * * *  For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental and vision coverage, life insurance, 401K, sick pay (in states where required), employee assistance programs, company discounts, perks and more! We also offer part-time and flexible schedules!* *  * * *  APPLY NOW* *  * * Allied Universal Services is seeking the position of a Security Site Supervisor.*  * The Security Site Supervisor will supervise and coordinate the delivery of quality services to an assigned customer. The Security Site Supervisor will act as a liaison between customers, Operation Managers and security officers. They will supervise site staff and provide coaching, recognition and discipline within approved empowerment range.*  * QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS:*  Be at least 21 years of age with high school diploma or equivalent*   Possess effective written and oral communication and interpersonal skills with ability to deal with all levels of personnel and the general public in a professional and effective manner*  *   *     Licensing requirements are subject to state and/or local laws and regulations and may be required prior to employment.*   *   As a condition of employment, employee must successfully complete a background investigation and a drug screen in accordance with all federal, state, and local laws*   Display exceptional customer service and communication skills*   Have intermediate computer skills to operate innovative, wireless technology at client specific sites*   Ability to handle crisis situations at the client site, calmly and efficiently*   Capably utilize scheduling and billing software to produce reports (such as Scheduling Activity, Training Detail reports, etc.) that require interpretation and action for effective business management*   Enforce Contract Standards*   Administers site safety programs outlining site-specific hazards for security officers including vehicle / driving safety as appropriate to corporate procedures*   Prepared to participate in unemployment hearings*   Enforces Allied Universal’s policies as outlined in the handbooks and executive memos *  Able to:*    Work in various environments such as cold weather, rain/snow or heat*     Occasionally lift or carry up to 40 pounds*     Climb stairs, ramps, or ladders occasionally during shift*     Stand or walk on various surfaces for long periods of time*   * *   Allied Universal® is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, age, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetic information, disability, protected veteran status or relationship/association with a protected veteran, or any other basis or characteristic protected by law. For more information: www.aus.com* *  * * *  If you have any questions regarding Equal Employment Opportunity, Affirmative Action, Diversity and Inclusion, have difficulty using the online system and require an alternate method to apply, or require an accommodation at any time during the recruitment and/or employment process, please contact our local Human Resources department. To find an office near you, please visit: www.aus.com/offices.* *

Title: Principal Cloud Architect
Description: BA/BS degree or 15+ years of professional or military experience*  15+ years of IT Infrastructure experience*  Experience facilitating discussions with senior leadership regarding technical / architectural trade-offs, best practices, and risk mitigation*  Direct hands-on experience leading the design, development and deployment of business software at scale or current hands on technology infrastructure, network, compute, storage, and virtualization experience*  Experience with software development life cycle (SDLC) and agile/iterative methodologies*  Experience with integration of AWS cloud services with on-premise technologies from Microsoft, IBM, Oracle, HP, SAP etc.*  Experience with IT compliance and risk management requirements (eg. security, privacy, SOX, HIPAA etc.)*Job summary At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we’re hiring highly technical cloud computing architects to help our partners develop technical expertise and capacity, while also collaborating with our customers and partners on key engagements. Our consultants will deliver proof-of-concept projects, topical workshops, and lead implementation projects. These professional services engagements will focus on key customer solutions such as web applications, enterprise applications, HPC, batch processing and big data, archiving and disaster recovery, education and government. Professional Services engage in a wide variety of projects for customers and partners, providing collective experience from across the AWS customer base and are obsessed about strong success for the Customer. Our team collaborates across the entire AWS organization to bring access to product and service teams, to get the right solution delivered and drive feature innovation based upon customer needs. Inclusive Team Culture Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust. Work/Life Balance Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed. Mentorship & Career Growth Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future. This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services as needed. ** Computer Science, Engineering or Math background preferred*   Hands-on knowledge of AWS services (EC2, ELB, RDS, Route53 & S3)*   Strong track record of implementing AWS services in a variety of distributed computing environments*   Ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges*   Leading highly-available and fault-tolerant enterprise and web-scale software deployments*   Infrastructure automation through DevOps scripting (E.g. shell, Ruby, Powershell)*   Configuration management using CloudFormation, Chef & Puppet*   Strong practical Linux and Windows-based systems administration skills in a Cloud or Virtualized environment*   Experience managing data center operations, including data assurance, monitoring, alerting and notifications*  Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.*

Title: Data Backup Administrator I
Description: * Schedule: Mon- Fri Overview: * *   Installs, configures, and maintains data backup/recovery appliances, UNIX data backup/recovery servers, as well as SaaS data backup/recovery solutions for heterogeneous client backup/restore in a multi-data center enterprise environment. Executes disaster recovery planning, implementation, and testing. Performs secondary role in assisting Business Continuity Team with architecting and implementing components of the IS division disaster recovery plan. Cybersecurity infiltration prevention, security hardening and protection of the data backup environments.* * * *   Continually improve our ransomware recovery RPO and RTO posture. Knowledge of on-prem, hybrid and cloud data backup and recovery solutions. Assumes responsibility for establishing and maintaining effective communications, coordination, and working relations with staff and management. Requires a familiarity with standard concepts, practices, and procedures within a particular field. Relies on experience and judgment not only to perform the functions of the job but also to set and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of tasks. Works under general supervision; typically reports directly to a manager and/or team lead. Job functions require exercising independent judgment. Requires a bachelor's degree in a related area and/or certification achievements and 5 or more years’ experience in the field or in a related area.*  Responsibilities:* * *   1. Installs, configures, and maintains data backup/recovery appliances as well as UNIX data backup servers for heterogeneous client backups/restores in a multi-data center enterprise environment.* * *   a. Installs, configures, and maintains Enterprise Class backup/recovery hardware and appliances.* * *   b. Installs, configures, and maintains Spectrum Protect data backup servers.* * *   c. Installs, configures, and maintains Enterprise Class backup/recovery clients (as needed) on UNIX, Linux, and Windows operating systems.* * *   d. Configures and maintains SaaS backup/recovery solutions.* * *   e. Understanding of Oracle RMAN, DB2 and MS-SQL backup/recovery concepts.* * *   f. Understanding VMware backup/recovery concepts.* * *   g. Assists in new hardware procurement including configuration assessment.* * *   h. Assists with hardware installation and configuration.* * *   i. Maintain licensing, software and hardware support contracts for solutions administered.* * *   j. Monitors daily client backups and researches and corrects client and server issues.* * *   k. Monitors backup/recovery hardware functionality and assists in hardware failure resolution.* * *   l. Performs both file-level and system restore using data backups.*  2. Disaster recovery planning, implementation, and testing.* * *   a. Architect disaster recovery backup/restore solution(s) across multiple datacenters.* * *   b. Implements disaster recovery backup/restore solution(s) using industry best practices.* * *   c. Continually tests disaster recovery backup/restore scenarios.* * * *   3. Performs secondary role in assisting Business Continuity/Safety Administrator with architecting and implementing components of IS division disaster recovery plan.* * *   a. Assist Business Continuity Team with DR architecture and component implementation.* * *   b. Assists IS personnel in maintaining the IS Business Continuity Plan.* * * *   4. Cybersecurity infiltration prevention, security hardening and protection of the data backup environments. Continually improve our ransomware recovery RPO and RTO posture.* * *   a. Knowledge of ransomware infiltration prevention, security hardening and protection techniques.* * *   b. Assists in backup/recovery system hardening procedures following vendor and industry best practices.* * *   c. Continuously improve our recovery posture from a ransomware attack.*  5. Knowledge of on-prem, hybrid and cloud backup/recovery solutions.* * *   a. General knowledge of various cloud backup/recovery solutions.* * * *   6. Assumes responsibility for establishing and maintaining effective communications, coordination, and working relations with staff and management.* * *   a. Keeps management informed of significant problems and of progress attained in reaching established objectives. Provides recommendations to establish new and more effective systems and future equipment needs. Suggests systems-related procedures and changes.* * *   b. Assists and supports Information Systems Division personnel as needed.* * *   c. Prepares reports of system activities and documents system procedures.* * *   d. Attends and participates in meetings and committees as required.*  Qualifications: * *   Training/Education/Certification:* *  Bachelor’s degree in computer related discipline, or a related field, or an equivalent combination of education, training, or work experience.* * *   Required Knowledge:* *  Understanding of Credit Union operations and information needs.*   Knowledge of commonly used concepts, practices, and procedures within information technology industry.*   Knowledge of business software applications.* * *   Experience Required: * * 5 + years’ experience in field or related area.*   Data Backup/Restore and Disaster Recovery experience.*   Enterprise Class Data Backup and Recovery solution experience.*   Limited UNIX systems administration experience (Spectrum Protect servers run on AIX).*   Limited IBM pSeries hardware experience.* * *   Skills/Abilities:* *  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.*   Well-organized.*   Good communication skills.*   Ability to assist others.*   Able to use PC and terminal keyboards, various computer hardware.*

Title: Senior Infrastructure Security Engineer
Location: Remote in Salt Lake City, UT
Description: * *  Angi® is transforming the home services industry, creating an environment for homeowners, service professionals and employees to feel right at "home." For most home maintenance needs, our platform makes it easier than ever to find a qualified service professional for indoor and outdoor jobs, home renovations (or anything in between!). We are on a mission to become the home for everything home by helping small businesses thrive and providing solutions to financing and booking home jobs with just a few clicks. *   Over the last 25 years we have opened our doors to a network of over 200K service professionals and helped over 150 million homeowners love where they live. We believe home is the most important place on earth and are embarking on a journey to redefine how people care for their homes. Angi is an amazing place to build your dream career, join us—we cannot wait to welcome you home! * * About the Opportunity: *  At Angi, security is tightly woven into product and infrastructure development. We challenge our teams to build systems that are secure-by-default and to protect our users' most sensitive data. You will be joining a team of engineers who will champion security initiatives throughout the organization. You will be building tools to make secure-by-default easy. You will be conducting regular audits/tests to identify risks and prioritizing fixes for the identified risks. You will continue to raise the bar to make our systems secure. *  What you will do: * Implement security best practices in our cloud and on-premise IT environment following industry standards / recommendations. *  Identify vulnerabilities / missing patches across all physical servers, virtual servers, end user workstations, containers, etc. and ensure they are prioritized for remediation. *  Implement runtime security measures for our container environments. *  Ensure relevant audit and security logs are collected to a central location and exposed to the correct teams for triage, analysis, and incident response. *  Work with auditors and compliance teams to meet required policies and collect required evidence. *  Work with IT / Engineering teams to ensure admin rights are not needed on end user workstations for every day tasks and to ultimately trim down the number of users that have admin rights. *  Ensure all endpoints throughout the organization are configured with security settings that align with industry standards and that they have the relevant security tools (MDM, EDR, etc.) installed. *  Implement zero trust principles throughout the infrastructure that facilitates a BYOD model for certain use cases. *  Enhance incident response playbooks and leverage automation using SOAR products where possible. *  Actively participate in the design and implementation of applications, services, and infrastructure to ensure security and privacy design principles are being followed. *  Actively participate in all facets of the incident response lifecycle * Who you are: * You have a BS or an MS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Cyber Security, or a related field *  You have 4+ years of experience working on a security team supporting product/engineering functions, cloud infrastructure, and corporate infrastructure development *  You have experience in AWS specifically with one or more of the following AWS services: GuardDuty, Config, WAF, Shield, Macie, CloudTrail, SecurityHub. *  You have in-depth knowledge of security threats, applied cryptography, and risk assessments *  You have software engineering experience and an engineering mindset for building reliable and maintainable security infrastructure to support a large organization with CI/CD software engineering practices *  You have experience working with product development teams to empower them on advancing security initiatives *  You have experience defining and implementing internal practices and controls for PCI and SOX/ITGC information security compliance standards *  Willingness to learn and apply new skills and technologies *  Knowledge of Kubernetes or container technologies preferred * Compensation & Benefits * The salary band for this position ranges from $160,000 - $210,000 annually, commensurate with experience and performance. *  Full medical, dental, vision package to fit your needs *  Flexible vacation policy: work hard and take time when you need it *  Pet discount plans & retirement plan with company match (401K) * #LI-Remote *  #BI-Remote*

Title: Senior Business Analyst, Data Analytics
Location: Remote in Salt Lake City, UT
Description: * *  Angi® is transforming the home services industry, creating an environment for homeowners, service professionals and employees to feel right at "home." For most home maintenance needs, our platform makes it easier than ever to find a qualified service professional for indoor and outdoor jobs, home renovations (or anything in between!). We are on a mission to become the home for everything home by helping small businesses thrive and providing solutions to financing and booking home jobs with just a few clicks. *   Over the last 25 years we have opened our doors to a network of over 200K service professionals and helped over 150 million homeowners love where they live. We believe home is the most important place on earth and are embarking on a journey to redefine how people care for their homes. Angi is an amazing place to build your dream career, join us—we cannot wait to welcome you home! * * About the team *  The Sales & Client Success analytics team provides insights and helps optimize strategy by working closely with leadership in our sales and customer care organizations. Our business is a two-sided marketplace of homeowners and service professionals, which makes our jobs complex and data rich. We work daily with sales and customer care leadership teams to develop, execute, monitor, and refine initiatives that drive value and quantify that value as it pertains to financial performance. Due to the multifaceted nature of our business, our team provides an excellent environment to stretch your business acumen, technical know-how and quantitative skills while providing insight to the company. *  Additionally, this team will help support our Marketing team that focuses on growing our pro network. This involves surfacing metrics, providing insights, and identifying opportunities that align with company goals. *  What you'll do * Build curated data sources in star schema and develop data pipelines to support strategic and operational improvements. *  Synthesize large data sets into digestible information, primarily utilizing Snowflake, Excel, and Looker. *  Conduct deep dive analyses with the intent to provide actionable items that foster new and creative ways to enhance and improve performance. *  Learn the complex Angi ecosystem and be the subject matter expert on all data and objectives relating to the team you support. * Who you are * BA/BS in a quantitative field (Finance, Engineering, Economics, etc.) *  4+ years of professional experience in a data analyst or data engineering role. *  Advanced SQL, understanding of relational databases and Excel *  Strong understanding of data visualization best practices and dashboard development *  Basic to intermediate understanding of data modeling, data engineering concepts *  Experience with Looker and Snowflake is a plus * We value diversity *  We know that the best ideas come from teams where diverse points of view uncover new solutions to hard problems. We welcome and value individuals who bring diverse life experiences, educational backgrounds, cultures, and work experiences. *  Compensation & Benefits * The salary band for this position varies, commensurate with experience and performance. Compensation may vary based on factors such as cost of living. *  This position will be eligible for a competitive year end performance bonus & equity package. *  Full medical, dental, vision package to fit your needs *  Flexible vacation policy; work hard and take time when you need it *  Pet discount plans & retirement plan with company match (401K) *  The rare opportunity to work with sharp, motivated teammates solving some of the most unique challenges and changing the world * #LI-Remote #BI-Remote*

Title: Senior Information Security Analyst (BHJOB1435_28837)
Location: Salt Lake City, UT 84106 (Sugar House area)
Description: Senior Information Security Analyst*Responsibilities: *Physical Security.*Manages physical security activities and services.* Provides expert guidance to employees assigned to complex and critical physical, analytical, or technical security roles.* Provides technical leadership of resources responsible for regulatory compliance activities, or using sophisticated security* technologies that impact a diverse, complex energy company.* Interfaces and represents the company with a variety of federal, state and local government and law enforcement agencies. Ensures readiness and qualification of physical security personnel for daily security activities, as well as contingency response during emergencies.* Manages costs for security services. Acts as expert on security issues and provides advice to management.* Manages security initiatives to facilitate effective infrastructure protection strategies through client.* Ensures security regulatory compliance throughout client.* Manages the development of security plans and protocols to support regulatory and non-regulatory compliance at company facilities, related to access control.* Provides technical leadership on all physical security aspects of the regulatory compliance process.* Ensures completion of timely, relevant, energy-related intelligence gathering and reporting for internal and external stakeholders.* Develops and manages development of security plans, policies, procedures, and risk assessments.* Manages contracts for physical and technical security services and ensure compliance.* Oversees and conducts diverse, complex, and sensitive investigations into issues of significant consequence to the company.* Conducts investigative interviews with internal and external subjects.* Provides reports and presentations of investigative results.* Develops and maintains a contingency plan for client services in case of a catastrophic event.* Leads in emergency planning and implementation.* Supports local safety committees and company efforts to ensure a safe work environment.*Facilities Management.*Manages all aspects of office services functions, to ensure efficiency in forms and procedures management, mailing services, records management, subscription centralization, and printing services.* Print services include printing, shipping, and warehousing of print material, supplies, and completed products, and providing copy center functions.* Manages contracts and conducts performance reviews of contractors.* Manages acquisition, disposition, and leasing of company real estate, including offices, warehouses, raw land, and property across client.* Participates on site selection committees when company groups are determining locations of future offices or facilities.* Works with national real estate firm for market data and system support.* Prepares strategy for negotiating property sales, purchases, and lease buyouts.* Develops acquisition and disposition budgets.* Interacts with legal counsel for appropriate real estate support.* Supports asset mergers, acquisitions, and dispositions involving real estate.* Advises and provides daily guidance to all business units on real estate matters.* Manages real estate associated with client assets.*Supply Chain/Fleet Management.*Leads and manages client processes and resources for sourcing, logistics, and materials management efforts and interfaces with other functions to meet business needs.* May manage spend analysis, prioritization, and selection of sourcing initiatives.* May lead in major negotiations.* May manage supplier integration.* May establish technical and quality requirements, on safety and non-safety materials and services.* May manage material control functions including warehousing, reclamation activities, and inventory control.* May maintain effective asset recovery program.* Manages client fleet including vehicles and equipment.* This involves procurement, establishing specifications and standards for vehicles, managing vehicle leases, titling, licenses,* rentals, disposition of retiring vehicles, and all other administrative requirements for maintaining a vehicle fleet.*Required Knowledge, Skills, Abilities & Experience: *7+ years of related experience.* Good planning, organizational and project management skills.* Effective decision-making skills.* Effective customer service skills.* Effective in team development and leadership skills in a diverse organization.* Effective negotiating skills.* Strong verbal and written communication skills, including interpersonal, facilitation, and presentation capabilities.* Effective in cost-saving initiatives, utilizing Lean Tools, and driving positive, financial impacts.* Effective in driving supplier diversity.* Ability to manage a diverse staff, in a large geographic area, with multiple locations.* Ability to think analytically and solve complex problems.* Ability to understand and provide guidance on code of conduct and regulatory issues.* Ability to develop, manage, and monitor project performance, to ensure results meet project requirements, budgets, and schedules* Education Level: Degree or an equivalent combination of education and demonstrated related experience may be accepted in lieu of preferred level of education:* Bachelor’s Degree, Business Administration preferred* Valid driver’s license required.*Job Type: Contract*Benefits:*Dental insurance* Health insurance* Vision insurance*Schedule:*8 hour shift* Day shift* Monday to Friday*Ability to commute/relocate:*Salt Lake City, UT 84106: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)*Application Question(s):*Are you a US citizen or permanent resident?*Education:*Bachelor's (Preferred)*Experience:*Cybersecurity: 7 years (Preferred)* Information security: 7 years (Preferred)*License/Certification:*Driver's License (Required)*Work Location: One location

Title: Data Scientist, Data Science & Modeling
Description: The Data Scientist position will work closely with the other Data Scientists and Data Engineers on the team to produce the machine learning models, statistical models, and complex statistical analyses for the bank. This position works on state of the art problems, using state of the art systems, on a team with dozens of years of combined expertise and experience that truly believes in team work, as well as individual growth and development. * Data Science is a cross disciplinary field, which aims to combine statistical methods with computer science and business domain knowledge. A data scientist will have experience deploying statistical methods and machine learning to derive actionable insights, data visualizations, and models often from disparate data sources, and be able to communicate those learnings to management. They will also understand how to deploy predictive models into key business processes in order to improve the efficiency and efficacy of such processes. *Essential Functions:*Ability to do statistical programming, model development and implementation. * Designs, validates, and improves data driven decision making processes and strategies. * Builds key metrics and modeling reports for communication with executives. *Education and Experience:*Master's degree in statistics, artificial intelligence, machine learning or related field is required. * Experience as a Data Scientist is not necessary, but would be desirable. *Summary of Qualifications:*Experience with R or Python is required. * Knowledge of statistical theory, data mining, or machine learning algorithms is required. * Experience working with a variety of data sources, and expertise working with databases including query languages such as SQL. * Ability to understand the difficulties that arise from working with ‘big data’: distributed systems and databases, cloud based software stacks, and distributed computing clusters would be highly desirable. * Experience with any of the following computer languages is preferred: FORTRAN, C/C++, SAS, Unix shell scripting, or LaTeX. * Experience with traditional HPC (High Performance Computing) clusters would be a plus. Experience with SLURM is preferred. * Experience with GPGPU (General Purpose Graphical Processing Unit) computing: i.e., building models on a GPU rather than a CPU is preferred. * Ability to communicate results, both verbally and in writing. * Ability to work both individually and in a collaborative manner with a team. * Eligibility Requirements *In order for an internal applicant to be considered for an open role, the following criteria must be met: *The applicant must have been in their current position for a minimum of 6 months; * The applicant must not have be issued a Documented Verbal Warning in the past 3 months, on a Formal Written Warning, or on a suspension from work. * Exceptions to these criteria can only be made with the approval of the BU Leader and the EVP and Chief People Officer.

We own and operate 1,867 miles of pipeline with *total daily capacity of 2,530 MDth. * We are excited about the recent acquisition of MountainWest Pipeline by Southwest Gas Holdings. MountainWest *Pipeline’s rich history and our shared values of safety and excellence are a perfect fit, creating a desirable work *environment where our team members can build robust and satisfying careers. * We offer a wide range of opportunities, including positions as environmental and operational technicians, *engineers, design technologists, field operators, corporate services, and more. When joining our team, employees *are welcomed into a supportive community with an inclusive culture, enjoying comprehensive benefits, exciting *work responsibilities, and career-supportive learning resources. * We value all the communities we serve because we live and work as members of those communities. Operating *safely and responsibly is a commitment we proudly make as community members and stewards. This shows in *our collaborative spirit, respect for our customers and community partners, and our dedication to continuous *improvement. * Job Summary - Physical Security Details *This Manager position ensures safe and cost-effective measures in providing MountainWest Pipeline, LLC (MW) *support services including: Physical Security, Facilities Management and Supply Chain/Fleet Management. * Physical Security. *o Manages physical security activities and services related to MW. *o Provides expert guidance to employees assigned to complex and critical physical, analytical, or technical security roles. *o Provides technical leadership of resources responsible for regulatory compliance activities, or using sophisticated security *technologies that impact a diverse, complex energy company. *o Interfaces and represents the company with a variety of federal, state and local government and law enforcement agencies. Ensures readiness and qualification of physical security personnel for daily security activities, as well as contingency response during emergencies. *o Manages costs for security services. Acts as expert on security issues and provides advice to management. *o Manages security initiatives to facilitate effective infrastructure protection strategies through MW. *o Ensures security regulatory compliance throughout MW. *o Manages the development of security plans and protocols to support regulatory and non-regulatory compliance at company facilities, related to access control. *o Provides technical leadership on all physical security aspects of the regulatory compliance process. *o Ensures completion of timely, relevant, energy-related intelligence gathering and reporting for internal and external stakeholders. *o Develops and manages development of security plans, policies, procedures, and risk assessments. *o Manages contracts for physical and technical security services and ensure compliance. *o Oversees and conducts diverse, complex, and sensitive investigations into issues of significant consequence to the company. *o Conducts investigative interviews with internal and external subjects. *o Provides reports and presentations of investigative results. *o Develops and maintains a contingency plan for MW Services in case of a catastrophic event. *o Leads in emergency planning and implementation. *o Supports local safety committees and company efforts to ensure a safe work environment. * Job Summary - Facilities Management and Supply Chain/Fleet Management Details * Facilities Management. *o Manages all aspects of office services functions, to ensure efficiency in forms and procedures management, mailing services, records management, subscription centralization, and printing services. *o Print services include printing, shipping, and warehousing of print material, supplies, and completed products, and providing copy center functions. *o Manages contracts and conducts performance reviews of contractors. *o Manages acquisition, disposition, and leasing of company real estate, including offices, warehouses, raw land, and property across MW. *o Participates on site selection committees when company groups are determining locations of future offices or facilities. *o Works with national real estate firm for market data and system support. *o Prepares strategy for negotiating property sales, purchases, and lease buyouts. *o Develops acquisition and disposition budgets. *o Interacts with legal counsel for appropriate real estate support. *o Supports asset mergers, acquisitions, and dispositions involving real estate. *o Advises and provides daily guidance to all business units on real estate matters. *o Manages real estate associated with MW assets. * Supply Chain/Fleet Management. *o Leads and manages MW processes and resources for sourcing, logistics, and materials management efforts and interfaces with other functions to meet business needs. *o May manage spend analysis, prioritization, and selection of sourcing initiatives. *o May lead in major negotiations. *o May manage supplier integration. *o May establish technical and quality requirements, on safety and non-safety materials and services. *o May manage material control functions including warehousing, reclamation activities, and inventory control. *o May maintain effective asset recovery program. *o Manages MW fleet including vehicles and equipment. *o This involves procurement, establishing specifications and standards for vehicles, managing vehicle leases, titling, licenses, *rentals, disposition of retiring vehicles, and all other administrative requirements for maintaining a vehicle fleet. * Required Knowledge, Skills, Abilities & Experience *o 7+ years of related experience. * The knowledge, skills, abilities and experience required for entry into this job include the following: *o Good planning, organizational and project management skills. *o Effective decision-making skills. *o Effective customer service skills. *o Effective in team development and leadership skills in a diverse organization. *o Effective negotiating skills. *o Strong verbal and written communication skills, including interpersonal, facilitation, and presentation capabilities. *o Effective in cost-saving initiatives, utilizing Lean Tools, and driving positive, financial impacts. *o Effective in driving supplier diversity. *o Ability to manage a diverse staff, in a large geographic area, with multiple locations. *o Ability to think analytically and solve complex problems. *o Ability to understand and provide guidance on code of conduct and regulatory issues. *o Ability to develop, manage, and monitor project performance, to ensure results meet project requirements, budgets, and schedules * Education Requirements *o Education Level: Degree or an equivalent combination of education and demonstrated related experience may be accepted in lieu of preferred level of education: *o Bachelor’s Degree, Business Administration preferred * Licenses, Certifications, or Quals Description *o Valid drivers license required. * Working Conditions *o Office Work Environment 76 -100% *o Travel Up to 25%

Title: Sr Software Engineer
Description: * At Cox Automotive, our engineers and technologists are literally changing the way people buy, sell and use cars. With operations across five continents and brands like Autotrader and Kelly Blue Book in our family, we have the reach to make this transformation happen in new and exciting ways. From browsing to test driving, purchasing to servicing, we’re taking charge to create the future of automotive. We’ve got some of the most robust data in the industry, so our big data insights can lead to some pretty amazing software creations. * And now, we’re building a future that is autonomous, connected, electric and shared. And you could make this a reality. All while working in an environment that puts collaboration and culture at the forefront of everything we do. * What You’ll Do * You’ll rely on strong leadership skills to make decisions, support your vision, influence your team and earn their trust. *  You’ll work cross functionally with other engineers and analysts to make sure everything we deliver is of the highest caliber. Your efforts will pave the way for consumers, dealers and lenders to seamlessly transact by providing secure, reliable and easy ways to manage the entire life cycle of a digital contract. *  You will drive the engineering solutions for the projects you’re spearheading, guiding the technical direction of your scrum team. You will also work to influence the technical direction across teams collaborating on high-impact projects. *  You’ll work with our engineers, guiding and coaching them so they grow, learning about their challenges and helping them emerge as even stronger coders and tech leaders. *  You’ll expect quality in everything you and your team do, while embracing a spirit of agility and creativity. You’ll always be looking for ways we can improve, and you’ll ask all the right questions to find better ways to get things done. *  You’ll rely on your exceptional technology, process, and people skills to resolve issues, create transformative products and drive positive change. You understand security always needs to be top-of-mind, and you’ll make sure your scrum team walks the walk with standards and guidelines. * What’s In It For You? * We want you to feel cared for and respected (like you do with our customers), and that starts with Cox’s highly competitive pay and other compensation perks (401k + company matching, comprehensive medical benefits, etc.). We also offer discounted Cox services, tuition reimbursement for academic pursuits, adoption assistance, paid time off to volunteer, childcare and eldercare resources, pet insurance and much more. * Good work should be rewarded, and not just with a healthy paycheck. And while we may be innovation obsessed, we never forget that we are human powered. So, it’s our goal to make sure you feel recognized for your contributions. It’s also important to work alongside colleagues who “get you.” At Cox, you will find a workplace where relationships are crafted with care and successes are celebrated with high fives. We strive to create an environment where you can do you, and everyone from leadership to new hires can support and feel supported. * We know you’re always looking for growth and the opportunity to learn new things. At Cox Automotive, you’ll have all kinds of opportunities to expand your expertise and grow your skills in ways that will challenge and empower you. And in the future, you may have the opportunity to drive innovation in other sectors where the Cox family of brands operates like cleantech, health care and esports. * You’ll also get to work with a wide range of products and technologies across the Cox Automotive ecosystem, allowing you to have a hands-on experience in transforming an industry. We don’t believe in limitations, only possibilities. Our technological capabilities combined with your wisdom and wizardry will allow us to grow the good and drive incredible innovation. * You’ll work alongside fantastic people who want to see you succeed. At Cox, we are eternal optimists and we strive to bring out the best in everyone. Our beliefs, our ways of working and lifting each other up, our knowledge, and our commitment to people and purpose all form a cultural fabric that is remarkably flexible, but extraordinarily strong. * You’ll quite literally have an opportunity to make the world a better place. That may sound like hyperbole, but it’s true. Across the Cox family of businesses, we’ve launched a movement to positively impact 34 million lives by 2034 in areas like technology access and education, social equity, and environmental sustainability through a wide range of company programs, partnerships and employee volunteer opportunities. * Who You Are * You are curious, open-minded and optimistic. A real go-getter. You welcome new ideas and people who are different from you, and you’re ready to make your mark at a company that is building a brighter future for the next generation. * You’ve got a bachelor’s degree, most likely in Computer Science or Engineering. *  You’ve got at least two years’ experience with AWS and have worked intimately with AWS cloud native applications. *  You’re a polyglot, someone who is comfortable with a variety of programming languages. Our stack is primarily .NET Core, with DynamoDB as our traditional data store and React for our user interfaces. AWS serving as our cloud provider, which allows us to focus on and leverage serverless technologies. *  You’ve got some history with implementing CI/CD pipelines, docker containers, and blue/green deployments, as well as creating and deploying scalable API’s leveraging API gateways. *  You’re comfortable breaking a monolithic application down into smaller services. *  You’ll often hear differing opinions, and you’ll show that you can change your opinion when new information comes along that changes the dynamic. Your courage and natural humility will be on full display when you make a mistake by owning it and then learning from it. *  You comfortable in areas like network, storage, infrastructure or security. In fact, you may even be a “full stack engineer,” not limited to programming languages.*  To be employed in this role, you’ll need to clear a pre-employment background check and drug test. Cox Automotive does not currently consider a pre-employment drug test for marijuana for this position. However, we are a drug-free workplace, so the possession, use or being under the influence of drugs illegal under federal or state law during work hours, on company property and/or in company vehicles is prohibited.* About Cox Automotive *  At Cox Automotive, people of every background are driven by their passion for mobility, innovation and community. We transform the way the world buys, sells, owns and uses cars, accelerating the industry with global powerhouse brands like Autotrader, Kelley Blue Book, Manheim and more. What’s more, we do it all with an emphasis on employee growth and happiness. Drive your future forward and join Cox Automotive today! *  About Cox *  Cox empowers employees to build a better future and has been doing so for over 120 years. With exciting investments and innovations across transportation, communications, cleantech and healthcare, our family of businesses – which includes Cox Automotive and Cox Communications – is forging a better future for us all. Ready to make your mark? Join us today! *  - *  Benefits of working at Cox may include health care insurance (medical, dental, vision), retirement planning (401(k)), and paid days off (sick leave, parental leave, flexible vacation/wellness days, and/or PTO). For more details on what benefits you may be offered, visit our benefits page. *  Cox is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer - All qualified applicants/employees will receive consideration for employment without regard to that individual’s age, race, color, religion or creed, national origin or ancestry, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, physical or mental disability, veteran status, genetic information, ethnicity, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by law. Cox provides reasonable accommodations when requested by a qualified applicant or employee with disability, unless such accommodations would cause an undue hardship. *  Statement to ALL Third-Party Agencies and Similar Organizations: Cox accepts resumes only from agencies with which we formally engage their services. Please do not forward resumes to our applicant tracking system, Cox employees, Cox hiring manager, or send to any Cox facility. Cox is not responsible for any fees or charges associated with unsolicited resumes.*

Title: Forensic Analyst
Description: * Are you passionate about technology and interested in joining a community of collaborative colleagues who respectfully and courageously seek to challenge the status quo? If so, read on to learn more about an exciting opportunity with Deloitte's Information Technology Services (ITS). We are curious and life-long learners focused on technology and innovation. *  Work you'll do *  We are currently looking to add a self-motivated professional to our passionate, innovative, and results-driven Digital Forensics & Investigations Team. The Team is deeply committed to the protection of the Deloitte brand, our practitioners, and our clients.* Support the Digital Forensic & Investigations Team in high tech investigations in the form of electronic evidence, computer forensic analysis, e-mail analysis, data recovery and network assessments in support of our Legal, Talent, Confidentiality and Insider Threat organizations. *  Perform computer forensic / investigative services including digital evidence collection, preservation, analysis, data recovery, electronic mail extraction, and database examination *  Perform technical analyses and interpretations of computer-related evidence such as e-mail and information stored on electronic devices *  Document and generate examination reports to communicate findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders; and provide actionable recommendations when necessary *  Contribute to the overall process improvement of investigation policies and processes *  Collaborate with leadership and stakeholders, including, but not limited to, internal clients such as legal, talent, insider threat, incident response, and cyber security leadership *  Keep up to date of emerging digital forensic and investigation trends, technologies, and techniques *  Evaluate, test, recommend, and integrate new Electronic Discovery and/or Computer Forensic tools and technologies *  Develop unique and creative solutions to problems on the fly to successfully perform mission critical tasks *  The team *  Information Technology Services (ITS) helps power Deloitte's success, which serves many of the world's largest, most respected organizations. We develop and deploy cutting-edge internal and go-to-market solutions that help Deloitte operate effectively and lead in the market. Our reputation is built on a tradition of delivering with excellence. *  The ~3,000 professionals in ITS deliver services including:* Cyber Security *  Technology Support *  Technology & Infrastructure *  Applications *  Relationship Management *  Strategy & Communications *  Project Management *  Financials * Cyber Security *  Cyber Security vigilantly protects Deloitte and client data. The team leads a strategic cyber risk program that adapts to a rapidly changing threat landscape, changes in business strategies, risks, and vulnerabilities. Using situational awareness, threat intelligence, and building a security culture across the organization, the team helps to protect the Deloitte brand. *  Areas of focus include:* Risk & Compliance *  Identity & Access Management *  Data Protection *  Cyber Design *  Incident Response *  Security Architecture *  Business Partnership *  Basic Qualifications:* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent professional experience *  Minimum 2 years of experience in any combination of roles as a Security Analyst, Incident Responder, Forensic Examiner, and / or Enterprise Mail Administrator *  No Sponsorship: Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future *  Preferred Qualifications:* Availability to work under tight deadlines in fast-paced environment *  Verifiable skills performing computer investigations *  Strong communication, interpersonal, analytical, problem-solving skills, and an overall attention to details *  Understanding of forensic protocols & artifacts, operating systems, and platforms *  For individuals assigned and/or hired to work in Colorado or Nevada, Deloitte is required by law to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. This compensation range is specific to the State of Colorado and the State of Nevada and takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Deloitte, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is $53,665 to $98,830. *  You may also be eligible to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance. *  #EA_ExpHire *  #EA_ITS_ExpHire *  #FY23_CS_50*

Title: Information Technology Auditor - Manager (Multiple Locations...
Description: * Do you thrive in times of disruption? Have a passion for turning challenges and opportunities into long-term competitive advantages? As a Seasonal Manager in Deloitte Risk & Financial Advisory, you'll have the opportunity to gain valuable hands-on experience working alongside leading professionals across diverse industries while building your professional skills in a variety of project experiences. *  Our Deloitte Risk & Financial Advisory practice helps organizations effectively navigate business risks and opportunities-from strategic, reputation, and financial risks to operational, cyber, and regulatory risks-to gain competitive advantage. We apply our experience in ongoing business operations and corporate lifecycle events to help clients become stronger and more resilient. *  Our market-leading team's help clients embrace complexity to accelerate performance, disrupt through innovation, and lead in their industries. This seasonal position is full-time and is expected to begin around late August 2022 and end around February 2023. * The team*  Deloitte Risk & Financial Advisory helps organizations navigate a variety of risks to lead in the marketplace and disrupt through innovation. The insights of our professionals, combined with our specialized products and services, help clients learn how to embrace complexity and leverage their position of strength to accelerate performance.*  Learn more about our Deloitte Risk & Financial Advisory practice at Deloitte. * Work you'll do*  Our professionals understand the dynamics of serving complex, global clients across multiple industries, and the importance of increasing transparency around business performance. We provide specialized audit analytics and internal control services for internal and external audit clients along with other services related to financial reporting. To further exploit opportunities and mitigate the risks presented by different markets, we also work with clients to navigate complexities, risks and opportunities presented by third-party relationships.*  The type of work you focus on will be influenced by your office placement and business needs. Your recruiter will be able to provide more information about our offices. Projects may be aligned to the following areas and include:*  Information Technology General Control Audits*   Third Party Assurance Reports (SOC 1,2,3)*   System Implementations*   Cyber Security Audits*   Internal Control Assessments*   Digital Control Design, Implementation and Operation*   Cloud Audits*  Regardless of project type, your work will require:*  Proficiency in verbal and written communication skills essential to interacting with clients and teams*   Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects/assignments/responsibilities in a fast-paced environment*   Problem solving and critical thinking skills*   Ability to quickly and concisely research and collect data from unique places*   Ability to synthesize data and convey information in a meaningful way*  Qualifications*  Required:*  BA/BS in Business Administration, Accounting, Computer Science, Information Systems*   Administration or related field*   7+ years of related experience within professional services, external audit or IT audit*   Demonstrated ability to plan and manage engagements along with ensuring deliverables meet work plan specifications and deadlines.*   Demonstrated experience auditing general computer controls and IT control testing of applications, operating systems, and databases.*   Strong background in auditing techniques and/or computer control environments*   Experience identifying controls, developing and executing test plans*   Demonstrated ability to write reports and to participate in presentations*   Experience with Sarbanes-Oxley and/or COSO*   Ability to travel 50%, on average, based on the work you do and the clients and industries/sectors you serve*   Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.*   You may also be eligible to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance business transformation, and/or innovation*   Availability to work full-time between late August 2022 until February 2023.*  Preferred:*  MBA or master's in accounting or Information Systems*   CPA, CISA or CISSP*   SAP or Oracle controls experience*

Title: IAM Engineer Senior Consultant
Description: * Are you an experienced, passionate pioneer in technology - a solutions builder, a roll-up-your-sleeves technologist who wants a daily collaborative environment, think-tank feel and share new ideas with your colleagues - without the extensive demands of travel? If so, consider an opportunity with our US Delivery Center - we are breaking the mold of a typical Delivery Center.*  Our US Delivery Centers have been growing since 2014 with significant, continued growth on the horizon. Interested? Read more about our opportunity below ...* Work you'll do * Utilize IAM (Identity and Access Management) programs to enable federal, state, local and/or higher education clients to protect against digital identity risks.*   Provide appropriate access to applications, systems, and data with advanced authentication.*   Oversee the spread of information with privileged access management.*   Multitask and switch gears to meet changing priorities and tasks to accomplish goals/objectives.*   Work in a distributed team environment where team members are spread across numerous locations and often communicate virtually to support clients IAM applications. *  Identify and evaluate complex business and technology risks, internal controls which mitigate risks, and related opportunities for internal control improvement*   Evaluate and support complex IAM and technology risks, internal controls which mitigate risks, and related opportunities for internal control improvement. *  Responsible to design, install, implement, architect, configure and maintain one or more Identity & Access Management products such as Okta, SailPoint, ForgeRock, CyberArk or other IAM technology in a client environment.*   Communicate the IAM aspects of both the production support and maintenance at the technical and functional level to maintain or resolve a technical situation. *  Facilitate use of technology-based tools or methodologies to review, design and/or implement products and services. * The team: *  From our centers, we work with Deloitte consultants to design, develop and build solutions to help clients reimagine, reshape and rewire the competitive fabric of entire industries. Our centers house a multitude of specialists, ranging from systems designers, architects and integrators, to creative digital experts, to cyber risk and human capital professionals. All work together on diverse projects from advanced pre-configured solutions and methodologies, to brand-building and campaign management. We are a unique blend of skills and experiences, yet we underline the value of each individual, providing customized career paths, fostering innovation and knowledge development with a focus on quality. The US Delivery Center supports a collaborative team culture where we work and live close to home with limited travel.* Qualifications * Required: * BA/BS Degree in Computer Science, Cyber Security, Information Security, Engineering, Information Technology, Finance, Business, Math or in other business-related fields. *  3+ years of experience with IAM design, architecture, implementation and maintenance of solutions such as SailPoint, Okta, CyberArk, ForgeRock*   Knowledge of Active Directory and LDAP *  Must be legally authorized to work in the United States with no sponsorship. *  Travel up to 15% *  Ability to obtain & maintain the required security clearance * Preferred: * Experience supporting Federal IT projects that integrate multiple ICAM/IAM technologies *  3+ years of demonstrated experience designing, architecting, implementing, operating, and maintaining identity management solutions supporting full identity lifecycle management, provisioning, role management, user access certifications, compliance, and access requests*   3+ years of experience designing, architecting, implementing, operating, and maintaining access control solutions supporting single sign on, multifactor authentication, adaptive access policies, and authorization policies for desktop and mobile devices *  3+ years of experience working with Windows servers, databases (e.g. SQL Server, MySQL), application servers (Tomcat, IIS, Apache).*   Knowledge of AWS, ServiceNow, Salesforce, Office365, SailPoint SecurityIQ, and CyberArk*   Must have good people skills, client management experience, and experience communicating technical information to business owners.*   Previous experience with developing technical SDLC documentation.*   Experience with onboarding and managing privileged accounts across network environments.*   Good organizational and time management skills*   Must be team-oriented and able to collaborate across many participating teams*   Prior professional services or federal consulting experience *  Previous identity analytics experience *  Additional Certifications (e.g., CompTIA Security+, CEH, CISSP* How you'll grow*  At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there's always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career. *  #LI-BH1*

Title: Data Analytics Consultant
Description: * The Team *  Transparency, innovation, collaboration, sustainability: these are the hallmark issues shaping GPS initiatives today. Deloitte's GPS practice is passionate about making an impact with lasting change. Carrying out missions in the GPS practice requires fresh thinking and a creative approach. We collaborate with teams from across our organization in order to bring the full breadth of Deloitte, its commercial and public sector expertise, to best support our clients. Our aspiration is to be the premier integrated solutions provider in helping to transform the GPS marketplace. *  Deloitte GPS Analytics mitigates current and future risk for our GPS clients across several industries, spanning from finance and audit readiness to forensics and healthcare. With a creative and innovative approach, our Analytics team exposes our clients' risks and provides recommendations to improve the quality of data. We collaborate closely with government agencies, accountants, IT professionals, and clients to produce analyses in support of risk consulting engagements. *  Are you an analytical, data-driven professional? Are you interested in a role that offers an opportunity to provide front line support to our clients instead of a "back office programmer" position? If so, Deloitte's Government and Public Services (GPS) Analytics team is the place for you! Join our team of specialists as they unlock insights contained in the data universe and work through challenges related to the identification of improper payments, data quality, mission-oriented analysis, and cost management. * Work you'll do *  In this role, you will specialize in and provide expertise in data analytics, data science/engineering, and data management. Other responsibilities include:* Participate in and/or lead the development of deliverable content that meets the needs of the client and contract *  Anticipate client needs and formulate solutions to client issues *  Review deliverables for accuracy and quality *  Manage own personal and professional development; seek opportunities for professional growth and expansion of consulting skills and experience *  Serve as a "Subject Matter Expert", adding interpretive value to data presented or experienced insight into a functional process or issue *  Identify and solve the data-analytics problems related to client's mission *  Work with mission analysts to help identify, clean and validate various data sets to ensure accuracy, completeness, and uniformity * Qualifications *  Required: * Must currently hold US Security Clearance *  Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future *  Bachelor's Degree in Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Engineering, Business Analytics disciplines, or related area *  3+ years of experience with data quality analysis, statistical analysis and/or modeling, data cleansing and data engineering *  Experience mining and analyzing transactional electronic data with competency in one or more of the following: SAS, SQL, SPSS, R, Python, ACP, IDEA Tableau, MATLAB, Visual Basic, Business Intelligence, Hadoop or Alteryx *  Preferred: * Previous Federal Consulting and/or professional services experience *  Applied knowledge of AWS/cloud development and solutions architecture *  Displays both breadth and depth of knowledge regarding functional and technical issues *  Experience presenting to clients or other decision makers to present and sell ideas to various audiences (technical and non-technical)*

Title: Data Science Lead
Description: * Data Science Lead*  Our firm is investing in new ways to deliver value to our clients, bringing IP to the market through the use of assets. The Assets & Hybrid Business Ventures (AHBV) offering was established to surface, build, incubate, scale, and maintain new, world-class technology-based assets focused on improving the customer experience. Among our highest-priority assets is TrueServe™, a contact center solution that integrates industry-leading capabilities through cutting-edge technology to transform our clients' abilities in customer support and service.*  Included in TrueServe™ is an "all-in-one" voice analytics solution that uses voice and text recordings to extract information through advanced analytics techniques, with models developed and managed by our specialized voice data scientist team to provide actionable business outcomes. This is just one example of the assets that our team is bringing to market to help us provide even faster time to value and reduced risk throughout our clients' transformation journeys.* Work you'll do:*  The Senior Data Scientist & Development Lead for our voice analytics solution in our Assets and Hybrid Business Ventures team will be responsible for delivering projects for our clients while advancing the internal capabilities of the solution. The technology landscape moves fast, so you will not be expected to be expert in each of the tools we currently use, but we are assuming a willingness to work outside your comfort zone to learn on the job. As a Data Scientist, you will apply machine learning, data visualization and statistical programming tools to interpret data. You will bring a strong background in developing and writing code to the team but will also have experience interacting with non-technical clients and stakeholders to deliver results.* Your responsibilities will include:*  Implementing large-scale data ecosystems including data management and integration of multiple complex systems to provide a seamless experience.*   Leveraging automation, cognitive, and science-based techniques to manage data.*   Developing data science and statistical methodologies to integrate them into product development.*  Minimum Qualifications:*  Bachelor's or master's degree in Math, Comp Sci, Data Science, Statistics, or equivalent practical experience.*   Experience and familiarity in scripting languages (Python, R, Matlab)*   4+ years of data science experience in a commercial or academic environment.*   Proven track record of working with cloud technologies such as AWS (Amazon Web Services), GCP (Google Cloud Platform), Azure.*   Experience applying machine learning algorithms and an understanding of which approaches are relevant in different scenarios:*   Supervised learning*    Unsupervised learning*    Natural language processing*    Graph algorithms*    Time series*   Strong delivery skills, and experience of managing multiple projects in a high paced environment.*   Strong planning, organization / people management skills.*   Self-driven with initiative for learning and implementing innovative technologies*   Exceptional communication, presentation and writing skills.*   A history of working collaboratively with a cross-functional team of engineers, data scientists and product managers*   Visualization tools (Tableau, Qlikview)*   Familiarity with Software Development Lifecycle (Agile, DevOps)*   Experience with DevOps tools (Docker, Jenkins)*   Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.*   Ability to travel up to 50%, on average, based on the work you do and the clients and industries/sectors you serve.*  Preferred Qualifications:*  Post-graduate degree in Math, Comp Sci, AI, Robotics, Data Science or equivalent/relevant field*   Database experience (SQL)*   Experience in command line (e.g. Bash)*   Understanding/experience with Data Privacy considerations*   Experience in signal processing/ML applied to audio/speech*   Knowledge about statistical modeling*   Client relationship management*  #LI-MV1*  #AHBV*
